title-group.article-title: vehicle Design Implications of the Turner Proposal

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1990 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The implications of restricting axle loads to preserve pavements while at the same time allowing gross combination weights over 80,000 pounds are examined with respect to the design qualities of the types of heavy trucks that might be developed. The proposed vehicles would have more axles than current designs thereby achieving higher gross combination weights with smaller axle loads. Design factors influencing mobility, productivity, preservation of the highway infrastructure, and performance in safetyâ€“related maneuvers are discussed.
